tool.name: Merge columns
tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool merges columns together
- Columns are specified as **c1**, **c2**, and so on. Column count begins with **1** - Columns can be specified in any order (e.g., **c2,c1,c6**)
-----
**Example**
Input dataset (five columns: c1, c2, c3, c4, and c5)::
1 10 1000 gene1 chr 2 100 1500 gene2 chr
merging columns "**c5,c1**" will return::
1 10 1000 gene1 chr chr1 2 100 1500 gene2 chr chr2
.. class:: infomark
Note that all original columns are preserved and the result of merge is added as the rightmost column.
